page.title: 17Settlement Chilton Village
page.content: The population of Chilton decreased from 260 to less than 100 as most people left in the early 20th century because their land was bought by landowners,but it has gone up again recently. Chilton Hall was built in Norman Times and some is 13th century.It was known as Ciltuna in the Domesday vils and belonged to the Goldling family.It is a moated farmhouse.Chiltons 15th century church called St. Marys has 15th century stained glass windows.Its parish once belonged to Great Waldingfield and was restored in 1868. It is opened once a month.An example of housing is a Norman Chapel turned into a 16th century cottage and is one of what were many old houses with inserted floors and chimney stacks.Housing has increased recently.
